intro: Chloraea nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined chloraea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland and heathland environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct venation pattern, which gives it its scientific name. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
